meanings.definition: To cause to occur or operate at the same time or rate.
meanings.sent1: The conductor was synchronising the movements of the musicians to create a harmonious performance.
meanings.sent2: The traffic lights are synchronising to ensure a smooth flow of vehicles.
meanings.sent3: The dance instructor had a hard time synchronising the clumsy dancers, but it was a hilarious sight.
meanings.sent4: Her heart and mind were synchronising in perfect rhythm, guiding her decisions effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized swimmers were perfectly synchronising their movements, creating a mesmerizing display.

meanings.definition: To coordinate in time or cause to occur at the same rate or time.
meanings.sent1: The project manager is synchronising the tasks to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent2: The coach is synchronising the team's efforts for a successful game.
meanings.sent3: The chef was synchronising the cooking times of multiple dishes like a time wizard.
meanings.sent4: The stars seemed to be synchronising their twinkling in the vast night sky.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized clocks in the train station were perfectly synchronising the departure times.
